intro: Leibnitzia nepalensis, commonly known as the Nepal leibnitzia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to the Himalayan regions of Nepal and northern India, typically growing in moist, shaded environments. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its root system is fibrous, and it is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
